meanings.definition: Menfolks: plural form of menfolk, referring to male relatives or members of a group
meanings.sent1: My menfolks always gather for Sunday dinners at grandma's house.
meanings.sent2: The menfolks in the neighborhood often play basketball together.
meanings.sent3: When the menfolks tried to cook dinner, it turned into a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the menfolks was as strong as steel, supporting each other through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The image of the menfolks laughing around the campfire stayed with her for years.

meanings.definition: Menfolks: a colloquial term for men or males in general
meanings.sent1: The party was a great success with all the menfolks enjoying themselves.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, menfolks would gather at the local barbershop for a chat.
meanings.sent3: The menfolks decided to have a barbecue competition to show off their grilling skills.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were bustling with menfolks going about their daily routines.
meanings.sent5: She admired the confidence of the menfolks as they walked down the street.
